name: @serkan-ozal/driflyte
description:
Discover available topics and explore up-to-date, topic-tagged web content. Search to surface the most relevant documents for your questions. Stay current with timely, real-world sources for grounded insights.

The Driflyte MCP Server exposes tools that allow AI assistants to query and retrieve topic-specific knowledge from recursively crawled and indexed web pages. With this MCP server, Driflyte acts as a bridge between diverse, topic-aware content sources (web, GitHub, and more) and AI-powered reasoning, enabling richer, more accurate answers.

tools.name: list-topics
tools.description: Returns a list of topics for which resources (web pages, etc ...) have been crawled and content is available. This allows AI assistants to discover the most relevant and up-to-date subject areas currently indexed by the crawler.

tools.name: search
tools.description: Given a list of topics and a user question, this tool retrieves the top-K most relevant documents from the crawled content. It is designed to help AI assistants surface the most contextually appropriate and up-to-date information for a specific topic and query. This enables more informed and accurate responses based on real-world, topic-tagged web content.

topK.description: The maximum number of relevant documents to return. Results are sorted by descending relevance score.

query.description: The natural language query or question for which relevant information is being sought. This will be used to rank documents by semantic relevance.

topics.description: A list of one or more topic identifiers to constrain the search space. Only documents tagged with at least one of these topics will be considered.

score.description: Similarity score (between 0 and 1) for the content of the document.

content.description: Related content (full or partial) of the matched document.

metadata.description: Metadata of the document and related content in key-value format.

items.description: Matched documents to the search query
